comments:
I20070327-0800

I can reproduce the following exception in a target workspace (it's not happening in most host IDE). If you would like the workspace, let me know.

Exception in thread "Java indexing" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.util.HashtableOfObject.<init>(HashtableOfObject.java:38)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.util.HashtableOfObject.rehash(HashtableOfObject.java:139)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.util.HashtableOfObject.put(HashtableOfObject.java:112)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.index.DiskIndex.copyQueryResults(DiskIndex.java:348)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.index.DiskIndex.mergeWith(DiskIndex.java:506)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.index.Index.save(Index.java:176)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.indexing.IndexManager.saveIndex(IndexManager.java:583)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.indexing.AddJarFileToIndex.execute(AddJarFileToIndex.java:200)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.processing.JobManager.run(JobManager.java:378)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)

I cannot reproduce this issue using the workspace Darin sent to me. After having this exception three times, he was no longer able to reproduce it either
=> we're OK to close it as remind for now and reopen if it will occur again...

I'm getting the same problem in my target workspace again. My host IDE is version  I20070424-0930.

Exception in thread "Java indexing" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.util.HashtableOfObject.<init>(HashtableOfObject.java:39)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.util.HashtableOfObject.rehash(HashtableOfObject.java:139)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.util.HashtableOfObject.put(HashtableOfObject.java:112)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.index.DiskIndex.copyQueryResults(DiskIndex.java:348)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.index.DiskIndex.mergeWith(DiskIndex.java:506)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.index.Index.save(Index.java:176)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.indexing.IndexManager.saveIndex(IndexManager.java:583)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.indexing.AddJarFileToIndex.execute(AddJarFileToIndex.java:200)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.processing.JobManager.run(JobManager.java:392)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)

Sounds like default VM Xmx args (ie. 64M) is not enough to index rt.jar for JDK 6.0. The target workspace must be launched using the IDE Xmx default (ie. 256M).

This issue has been already investigated and fixed by PDE/UI, so reopen to set as duplicate...
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 166223 ***
